text:
Pulcheria Alexandrovna sighed. 

“I don’t know who causes more misery,” she said. 

She glanced at Dounia, her daughter. 

“What do you think of Luzhin?” 

Razu-mihin spoke up. 

“He insulted Pyotr Petrovitch on purpose,” he declared. 

Pulcheria nodded, looking dejected. 

“Is that your opinion of him?” she asked. 

Razu-mihin replied, “I respect your daughter’s choice.” 

He blushed. 

“I was drunk last night. I lost my head.” 

Silence filled the room. 

Dounia's face flushed, but she said nothing.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses her concern about the potential misery between her daughter Dounia and her fiancé Pyotr Petrovitch, while Razumihin reflects on Raskolnikov's intentional insult towards him.
